profileText: A Delegate from Virginia; born in New Kent County, Va., in 1730; attended the common schools; clerk of Henrico County; journeyed to England in 1762 and attended to his extensive business interests there until 1774; returned before the Revolutionary War; member of the Virginia House of Burgesses and signed the Articles of Association May 27, 1774; chairman of the New Kent County Committee of Safety in 1774; Member of the Continental Congress in 1778 and 1779; a signer of the Articles of Confederation; moved to Augusta County, Va., in 1780; member of the State senate 1783-1786; died on his estate, ``Cowpasture,'' in Augusta County, Va., in August 1788.

researchRecord.name: 1785, 2 pages.
researchRecord.description: A copy of a will written by Thomas Adams on October 14, 1785 in Augusta County, Virginia.

researchRecord.name: In the Adams Family Papers, 1672-1792, 222 items.
researchRecord.description: The collection consists primarily of the business and political correspondence, 1762-1788, of Thomas Adams.

researchRecord.name: In the Adams Family Papers Section 6, 1672-1792, 156 items.
researchRecord.description: The papers include correspondence of Thomas Adams with Elizabeth (Griffin) Adams, Richard Adams (concerning tobacco and his election to the Virginia House of Burgesses and the burning of his warehouse in Richmond, Virginia), John Banister (bears diary [copy], 1778, of Caleb Gibbs kept during the siege of Newport, Rhode Island, by the U.S. Continental Army), and Richard Bland (concerning the appointment of an Anglican bishop for America, flooding of the James, Rappahannock, and Roanoke rivers in 1771, and paper currency).

researchRecord.name: In the Adams Family Papers Section 7, 1672-1792, 21 items.
researchRecord.description: Includes accounts from 1754-1772 kept by Thomas Adams at "Winslows," New Kent County and Richmond, Virginia, concerning, in part, Geroge Mercer and the estate of Harry Turner in 1771; Thomas Adams's clerkship of the Court of Henrico County, Virginia, in 1760,; and the Baltimore Iron Works, Baltimore, Maryland.

researchRecord.name: In the Adams Family Papers Section 8, 1672-1792, 3 items.
researchRecord.description: The papers include bills of lading from 1772 issued to Perkins, Buchanan & Brown of London, England by James Lowes for the shipment of goods to Thomas Adams. Also included in the papers is a bill of exchange, 1772, of William byrd, III, crawn o Robert Cary & Co. of London, England, to pay Thomas Adams.

researchRecord.name: In the Adams Family Papers Section 9, 1672-1792, 2 items.
researchRecord.description: The papers include an agreement from 1769 between Thomas Adams and John Morton Jordan (bearing seals and a tax stamp), as well as undated notes of Thomas Adams concerning William Brown, John Morton Jordan, and Perkins, Buchanan & Brown of London, England.

researchRecord.name: In the Adams Family Papers, 1782-1890, 9 items.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Thomas Adams. The papers also include the erection of burial monuments for members of the family and a printed bill of complaint concerning the private cemetery of the Adams family which details their genealogy.

researchRecord.name: In the Virginia General Assembly House of Burgesses Papers, 1774, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A printed copy of the Articles of Association signed by 89 members of the late House of Burgesses, 1774, including Thomas Adams.
